title: Handling Placeholder Arguments & Resource Not Found Errors
summary: How to recover when commands fail because of placeholders like [pod-name]/<namespace> or resource not found errors.
error_patterns: is not a real resource name
quick_fix: Run LIST_ALL (or FIND_ISSUES) to discover real names, then retry DESCRIBE/GET_LOGS/GET_EVENTS with the actual namespace/name.
symptoms: Tool output says arguments contain placeholders
Resource not found / unknown resource errors
Investigation stops before running real tools
diagnostics: Run LIST_ALL Pod (or Deployment/Service) to get real names
Run FIND_ISSUES to list unhealthy resources and namespaces
Avoid copying docs literallyâ€”replace placeholders with actual names
If NotFound persists, confirm namespace and resource kind

common_causes.cause: Placeholders or sample names used literally
common_causes.description: Docs or LLM responses kept [pod-name] or example-app instead of real names.
common_causes.fix: Discover real names via LIST_ALL/FIND_ISSUES; rerun DESCRIBE/GET_LOGS with actual ns/name.

common_causes.description: Resource exists in another namespace or a different kind (Deployment vs Pod).
common_causes.fix: Use LIST_ALL <kind> and specify the correct namespace.
Re-discover current names and target the latest pods/deployments.

fixes: Always start with FIND_ISSUES or LIST_ALL to discover actual names
Use DESCRIBE <kind> <ns> <name> after discovery; avoid placeholders
If NotFound persists, verify namespace and resource kind; list resources again
